title: 112_s1484
content: The Act is titled the "Hyde and Related Amendments Codification Act" and prohibits taxpayer-funded abortions while providing conscience protections in a new chapter added to Title 1 of the United States Code. The "Hyde and Related Amendments Codification Act" includes provisions such as prohibiting funding for abortions, restrictions on health benefits plans covering abortion, limitations on Federal facilities and employees, and treatment of abortions related to rape, incest, or preserving the life of the mother. The "Hyde and Related Amendments Codification Act" prohibits funding for abortions, restricts health benefits plans from covering abortion, and imposes limitations on Federal facilities and employees providing abortion services. The "Hyde and Related Amendments Codification Act" prohibits the use of Federal funds for health benefits coverage that includes abortion. It also limits abortion services in Federal facilities and for employees. Individuals, entities, or states can purchase separate abortion coverage as long as it is paid for with non-Federal funds. The text discusses the ability for individuals, entities, or states to purchase separate abortion coverage using non-Federal funds, as long as it does not involve matching funds from federally subsidized programs. It also allows non-Federal health benefits coverage providers to offer abortion coverage. Sec. 305 allows non-Federal health benefits coverage providers to offer abortion coverage using non-Federal funds, as long as no matching funds from federally subsidized programs are used. Sec. 306 ensures that this chapter does not affect other Federal laws limiting funds for abortion coverage. Sec. 306 states that this chapter does not impact other Federal laws restricting funds for abortion coverage. Sec. 308 exempts abortions resulting from rape, incest, or life-threatening conditions from the limitations set in sections 301, 302, and 303, regardless of federal or state law compliance or funding source. Sec. 309 clarifies that funds appropriated by Federal law include approved amounts in the District of Columbia budget. Sec. 310 prohibits government discrimination against certain health care. Sec. 310 prohibits government discrimination against certain health care entities, including individuals, hospitals, and providers, based on their stance on abortions. Sec. 310 prohibits discrimination by institutional health care entities that do not provide, pay for, cover, or refer for abortions. The term 'health care entity' includes individual physicians, hospitals, provider organizations, and health plans. Courts have jurisdiction to issue legal or equitable relief to prevent violations of this section. Courts have jurisdiction to prevent violations of Sec. 310 by issuing injunctions or orders preventing the disbursement of Federal financial assistance. Actions can be initiated by health care entities or the Attorney General of the United States. The Secretary of Health and Human Services designates the Director of the Office for Civil Rights to receive and investigate complaints of violations of this section, in coordination with the Attorney General.
